techmeme.title: London-based NexGen Cloud, which offers GPU-as-a-service for customers that need flexible access to train AI, raised a $45M Series A at a $354M valuation (David Prosser/Forbes)
A look at the rise of "Frankenstein" laptops in India, made by salvaging parts from multiple brands and sold to students, gig workers, and small businesses (The Verge)
Amazon expands Haul, its Temu competitor, to offer name-brand items from Amazon's US inventory, as the US plans to end de minimis tariff exemptions on May 2 (Theo Wayt/The Information)
Google says Deep Research is now available on Gemini 2.5 Pro Experimental for Gemini Advanced subscribers (Abner Li/9to5Google)
Aurascape, which offers enterprise security tools to mitigate risks from third-party AI apps, emerges from stealth with $50M from Menlo, Mayfield, and others (Ryan Naraine/SecurityWeek)
